<li id="cite_note-harv-21"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-harv_21-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBequaert1941">Bequaert, Joseph C. (1941). <a class="external text" href="http://hbs.bishopmuseum.org/pubs-online/pdf/op16-11.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>The Hippoboscidae of Oceania</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Harvard Medical School. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220124010141/http://hbs.bishopmuseum.org/pubs-online/pdf/op16-11.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 24 January 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 January</span> 2022</span>. <q>In the present taxonomic study of the Hippoboscidae, Oceania covers, rather arbitrarily, the many archipelagos and isolated islands scattered throughout the Pacific Ocean, from the Marianas and Caroline Islands, the Bismarck Archipelago, the Solomon Islands and New Caledonia to the Hawaiian islands and the Galapagos.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Hippoboscidae+of+Oceania&amp;rft.pub=Harvard+Medical+School&amp;rft.date=1941&amp;rft.aulast=Bequaert&amp;rft.aufirst=Joseph+C.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fhbs.bishopmuseum.org%2Fpubs-online%2Fpdf%2Fop16-11.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-22">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMargaret1983">Margaret, Cowan E. (1983). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/An_Analysis_of_the_Process_Used_to_Devel/JIGZhTRPSe4C?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22geographically+a+part+of+oceania%22&amp;dq=%22geographically+a+part+of+oceania%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>An Analysis of the Process Used to Develop a Publication of International Case Studies on Environmental Education</i></a>. University of Michigan Press. p. 9. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064235/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/An_Analysis_of_the_Process_Used_to_Devel/JIGZhTRPSe4C?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22geographically+a+part+of+oceania%22&amp;dq=%22geographically+a+part+of+oceania%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 July</span> 2022</span>. <q>Australia, as a separate continent, is geographically a part of Oceania</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=An+Analysis+of+the+Process+Used+to+Develop+a+Publication+of+International+Case+Studies+on+Environmental+Education&amp;rft.pages=9&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Michigan+Press&amp;rft.date=1983&amp;rft.aulast=Margaret&amp;rft.aufirst=Cowan+E.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FAn_Analysis_of_the_Process_Used_to_Devel%2FJIGZhTRPSe4C%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26bsq%3D%2522geographically%2Ba%2Bpart%2Bof%2Boceania%2522%26dq%3D%2522geographically%2Ba%2Bpart%2Bof%2Boceania%2522%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-23">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRainbird2009">Rainbird, Paul (2009). "Oceania: Pohnpei and the Eastern Carolines". <a class="external text" href="https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/abs/archaeology-of-islands/oceania-pohnpei-and-the-eastern-carolines/6D0AB9BA52B11EE632B0428E738901E5" rel="nofollow"><i>The Archaeology of Islands</i></a>. Cambridge University Press. pp. 90–113. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1017%2FCBO9780511619007.005" rel="nofollow">10.1017/CBO9780511619007.005</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780511619007" title="Special:BookSources/9780511619007"><bdi>9780511619007</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220124222422/https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/abs/archaeology-of-islands/oceania-pohnpei-and-the-eastern-carolines/6D0AB9BA52B11EE632B0428E738901E5" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 24 January 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 January</span> 2022</span>. <q>The thousands of islands of Oceania, excluding the island-continent of Australia and the very large island of New Guinea, are regarded by many as the theatre for island archaeology par excellence.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Oceania%3A+Pohnpei+and+the+Eastern+Carolines&amp;rft.btitle=The+Archaeology+of+Islands&amp;rft.pages=90-113&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2009&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1017%2FCBO9780511619007.005&amp;rft.isbn=9780511619007&amp;rft.aulast=Rainbird&amp;rft.aufirst=Paul&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cambridge.org%2Fcore%2Fbooks%2Fabs%2Farchaeology-of-islands%2Foceania-pohnpei-and-the-eastern-carolines%2F6D0AB9BA52B11EE632B0428E738901E5&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-edu_au-24"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-edu_au_24-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-edu_au_24-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-edu_au_24-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFFirthNaidu2019">Firth, Stewart; Naidu, Vijay (2019). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=cHmfDwAAQBAJ&amp;dq=%22spread+of+our+islands+allowed+a+great+deal+of+mobility+within+the+region%22&amp;pg=PA354" rel="nofollow"><i>Understanding Oceania: Celebrating the University of the South Pacific and its collaboration with The Australian National University</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-35"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-35">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFW._CasteelPasseron2011">W. <li id="cite_note-36"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-36">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBartholomew1873">Bartholomew, John (1873). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Zell_s_Descriptive_Hand_Atlas_of_the_Wor/gmSp46xxpJQC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22oceania%22+%22yokohama%22+%22australia%22&amp;pg=PA3&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Zell's Descriptive Hand Atlas of the World</i></a>. T.E. Zell. p. 7<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">20 August</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Zell%27s+Descriptive+Hand+Atlas+of+the+World&amp;rft.pages=7&amp;rft.pub=T.E.+Zell&amp;rft.date=1873&amp;rft.aulast=Bartholomew&amp;rft.aufirst=John&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FZell_s_Descriptive_Hand_Atlas_of_the_Wor%2FgmSp46xxpJQC%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522oceania%2522%2B%2522yokohama%2522%2B%2522australia%2522%26pg%3DPA3%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-austral-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-austral_37-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-austral_37-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-austral_37-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-austral_37-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFWallace1879">Wallace, Alfred Russel (1879). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Australasia/e2kcAAAAMAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22oceania+is+the+word+often%22&amp;pg=PA2&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Australasia</i></a>. The University of Michigan. p. 2. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064236/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Australasia/e2kcAAAAMAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22oceania+is+the+word+often%22&amp;pg=PA2&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 March</span> 2022</span>. <q>Oceania is the word often used by continental geographers to describe the great world of islands we are now entering upon [...] This boundless watery domain, which extends northwards of Behring Straits and southward to the Antarctic barrier of ice, is studded with many island groups, which are, however, very irregularly distributed over its surface. The more northerly section, lying between Japan and California and between the Aleutian and Hawaiian Archipelagos is relieved by nothing but a few solitary reefs and rocks at enormously distant intervals.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Australasia&amp;rft.pages=2&amp;rft.pub=The+University+of+Michigan&amp;rft.date=1879&amp;rft.aulast=Wallace&amp;rft.aufirst=Alfred+Russel&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FAustralasia%2Fe2kcAAAAMAAJ%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522oceania%2Bis%2Bthe%2Bword%2Boften%2522%26pg%3DPA2%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-38"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-38">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://academic.oup.com/edited-volume/34513" rel="nofollow"><i>The Oxford Handbook of World History</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>. 31 March 2011. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780199235810" title="Special:BookSources/9780199235810"><bdi>9780199235810</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 August</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Oxford+Handbook+of+World+History&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2011-03-31&amp;rft.isbn=9780199235810&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Facademic.oup.com%2Fedited-volume%2F34513&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-39"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-39">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFStephen_Henningham1995">Stephen Henningham (1995). <a class="external text" href="https://link.springer.com/content/pdf/bfm%3A978-0-230-37243-6%2F1.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>The Pacific island States</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Basingstoke: Macmillian. p. xii.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Pacific+island+States&amp;rft.place=Basingstoke&amp;rft.pages=xii&amp;rft.pub=Macmillian&amp;rft.date=1995&amp;rft.au=Stephen+Henningham&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Flink.springer.com%2Fcontent%2Fpdf%2Fbfm%253A978-0-230-37243-6%252F1.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-40"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-40">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://atlasescolar.ibge.gov.br/images/atlas/mapas_mundo/mundo_034_divisao_continentes.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Divisões dos continentes"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. IBGE. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210813231055/https://atlasescolar.ibge.gov.br/images/atlas/mapas_mundo/mundo_034_divisao_continentes.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 13 August 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 January</span> 2021</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Divis%C3%B5es+dos+continentes&amp;rft.pub=IBGE&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fatlasescolar.ibge.gov.br%2Fimages%2Fatlas%2Fmapas_mundo%2Fmundo_034_divisao_continentes.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-lewis32b-41"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-lewis32b_41-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFLewis_&amp;_Wigen,_The_Myth_of_Continents1997">Lewis &amp; Wigen, The Myth of Continents (1997)</a>, p. 32: "...the 1950s... was also the period when... Oceania as a "great division" was replaced by Australia as a continent along with a series of isolated and continentally attached islands. [Footnote 78: When Southeast Asia was conceptualised as a world region during World War II..., Indonesia and the Philippines were perforce added to Asia, which reduced the extent of Oceania, leading to a reconceptualisation of Australia as a continent in its own right. This manoeuvre is apparent in postwar atlases]"</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-42">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGrattan1961">Grattan, Clinton Hartley (1961). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/The_United_States_and_the_Southwest_Paci/K2Q3AAAAIAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22the+word+oceania%22+australia&amp;dq=%22the+word+oceania%22+australia&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>The United States and the Southwest Pacific</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-birds-52"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-birds_52-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-birds_52-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-birds_52-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-birds_52-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-birds_52-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSteadman2006">Steadman, David W. (2006). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Extinction_and_Biogeography_of_Tropical/vBZXJQ3HDg0C?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22tropical+%22easter+island%22+%22indo+australian+plate%22&amp;pg=PA7&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Extinction and Biogeography of Tropical Pacific Birds</i></a>. University of Chicago Press. p. 7. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780226771427" title="Special:BookSources/9780226771427"><bdi>9780226771427</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064236/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Extinction_and_Biogeography_of_Tropical/vBZXJQ3HDg0C?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22tropical+%22easter+island%22+%22indo+australian+plate%22&amp;pg=PA7&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">4 February</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Extinction+and+Biogeography+of+Tropical+Pacific+Birds&amp;rft.pages=7&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Chicago+Press&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=9780226771427&amp;rft.aulast=Steadman&amp;rft.aufirst=David+W.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FExtinction_and_Biogeography_of_Tropical%2FvBZXJQ3HDg0C%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522tropical%2B%2522easter%2Bisland%2522%2B%2522indo%2Baustralian%2Bplate%2522%26pg%3DPA7%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-plates-53"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-plates_53-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-plates_53-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-plates_53-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-plates_53-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-plates_53-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFNunnKumarEliotMcLean2016">Nunn, Patrick D.; Kumar, Lalit; Eliot, Ian; McLean, Roger F. (2 March 2016). <a class="external text" href="https://geoscienceletters.springeropen.com/articles/10.1186/s40562-016-0041-8" rel="nofollow">"Classifying Pacific islands"</a>. <i>Geoscience Letters</i>. <b>3</b>: 7. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2016GSL.....3....7N" rel="nofollow">2016GSL.....3....7N</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1186%2Fs40562-016-0041-8" rel="nofollow">10.1186/s40562-016-0041-8</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:53970527" rel="nofollow">53970527</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064858/https://geoscienceletters.springeropen.com/articles/10.1186/s40562-016-0041-8" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 February</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Geoscience+Letters&amp;rft.atitle=Classifying+Pacific+islands&amp;rft.volume=3&amp;rft.pages=7&amp;rft.date=2016-03-02&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A53970527%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1186%2Fs40562-016-0041-8&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2016GSL.....3....7N&amp;rft.aulast=Nunn&amp;rft.aufirst=Patrick+D.&amp;rft.au=Kumar%2C+Lalit&amp;rft.au=Eliot%2C+Ian&amp;rft.au=McLean%2C+Roger+F.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fgeoscienceletters.springeropen.com%2Farticles%2F10.1186%2Fs40562-016-0041-8&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-class-54"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-class_54-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-class_54-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFUdvardy">Udvardy, Miklos D.F. <a class="external text" href="https://fnad.org/Documentos/A%20Classification%20of%20the%20Biogeographical%20Provinces%20of%20the%20World%20Miklos%20D.F.%20Udvardy.pdf" rel="nofollow">"A Classification of the Biogeographical Provinces of the World"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. UNESCO. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220218131430/http://www.fnad.org/Documentos/A%20Classification%20of%20the%20Biogeographical%20Provinces%20of%20the%20World%20Miklos%20D.F.%20Udvardy.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 18 February 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-55"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-55">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.gochile.cl/en/destinations-easter-island-robinson-crusoe.htm" rel="nofollow">"Tourist attractions in Easter Island &amp; Robinson Crusoe"</a>. GoChile. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220202002755/https://www.gochile.cl/en/destinations-easter-island-robinson-crusoe.htm" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 2 February 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2 February</span> 2022</span>. <q>Despite being geographically located in Oceania, Juan Fernández Archipelago belongs to the insular Chilean territory, just like Easter Island.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Tourist+attractions+in+Easter+Island+%26+Robinson+Crusoe&amp;rft.pub=GoChile&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.gochile.cl%2Fen%2Fdestinations-easter-island-robinson-crusoe.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-ausgov-56"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ausgov_56-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFThomsonDoranClarke2018">Thomson, Lex; Doran, John; Clarke, Bronwyn (2018). <a class="external text" href="https://www.aciar.gov.au/sites/default/files/mn201_trees_for_life_-_final_artwork_-_15052018_web_upload_version.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>Trees for life in Oceania: Conservation and utilisation of genetic diversity</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Canberra, Australia: Australian Center for International Agricultural Research. p. 16. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220124215245/https://www.aciar.gov.au/sites/default/files/mn201_trees_for_life_-_final_artwork_-_15052018_web_upload_version.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 24 January 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 January</span> 2022</span>. <q>In a number of cases, human exploitation of certain high-value tree species, including sandalwoods and other highly prized timbers, has led to their extinction—such as the sandalwood species <i>Santalum fernandezianum</i>, in Juan Fernández Islands; and others to the brink of extinction, such <i>S. boninensis</i> in Ogasawara Islands, Japan; or is an ongoing threatening factor in the examples of <i>S. yasi</i> in Fiji and Tonga, <i>Gyrinops spp</i>. in Papua New Guinea (PNG) and <i>Intsia bijuga</i> throughout the Pacific Islands.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Trees+for+life+in+Oceania%3A+Conservation+and+utilisation+of+genetic+diversity&amp;rft.place=Canberra%2C+Australia&amp;rft.pages=16&amp;rft.pub=Australian+Center+for+International+Agricultural+Research&amp;rft.date=2018&amp;rft.aulast=Thomson&amp;rft.aufirst=Lex&amp;rft.au=Doran%2C+John&amp;rft.au=Clarke%2C+Bronwyn&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aciar.gov.au%2Fsites%2Fdefault%2Ffiles%2Fmn201_trees_for_life_-_final_artwork_-_15052018_web_upload_version.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-57"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-57">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFKladnik2017">Kladnik, Drago (2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Terraced_Landscapes/69V7DwAAQBAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22geographically+part+of+oceania%22&amp;pg=PA47&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Terraced Landscapes</i></a>. Založba ZRC. p. 47. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9789610500193" title="Special:BookSources/9789610500193"><bdi>9789610500193</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064236/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Terraced_Landscapes/69V7DwAAQBAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22geographically+part+of+oceania%22&amp;pg=PA47&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 July</span> 2022</span>. <q>In North America, agricultural terraces are exclusive to Mexico and the United States – which Hawaii, in the Pacific, is also part of, but is otherwise geographically part of Oceania.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Terraced+Landscapes&amp;rft.pages=47&amp;rft.pub=Zalo%C5%BEba+ZRC&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.isbn=9789610500193&amp;rft.aulast=Kladnik&amp;rft.aufirst=Drago&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FTerraced_Landscapes%2F69V7DwAAQBAJ%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522geographically%2Bpart%2Bof%2Boceania%2522%26pg%3DPA47%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-realm-58"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-realm_58-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-realm_58-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-realm_58-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-realm_58-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-realm_58-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFTodd1974">Todd, Ian (1974). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Island_Realm/gcEJAQAAIAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22French+language+cultures%22+1974+pacific&amp;dq=%22French+language+cultures%22+1974+pacific&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Island Realm: A Pacific Panorama</i></a>. Angus &amp; Robertson. p. 190. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780207127618" title="Special:BookSources/9780207127618"><bdi>9780207127618</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220618161036/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Island_Realm/gcEJAQAAIAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22French+language+cultures%22+1974+pacific&amp;dq=%22French+language+cultures%22+1974+pacific&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 18 June 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2 February</span> 2022</span>. <q>[we] can further define the word <i>culture</i> to mean <i>language</i>. Thus we have the French language part of Oceania, the Spanish part and the Japanese part. The Japanese culture groups of Oceania are the Bonin Islands, the Marcus Islands and the Volcano Islands. These three clusters, lying south and south-east of Japan, are inhabited either by Japanese or by people who have now completely fused with the Japanese race. Therefore they will not be taken into account in the proposed comparison of the policies of non - Oceanic cultures towards Oceanic peoples. On the eastern side of the Pacific are a number of Spanish language culture groups of islands. Two of them, the Galapagos and Easter Island, have been dealt with as separate chapters in this volume. Only one of the dozen or so Spanish culture island groups of Oceania has an Oceanic population — the Polynesians of Easter Island. The rest are either uninhabited or have a Spanish - Latin - American population consisting of people who migrated from the mainland. Therefore, the comparisons which follow refer almost exclusively to the English and French language cultures.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Island+Realm%3A+A+Pacific+Panorama&amp;rft.pages=190&amp;rft.pub=Angus+%26+Robertson&amp;rft.date=1974&amp;rft.isbn=9780207127618&amp;rft.aulast=Todd&amp;rft.aufirst=Ian&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FIsland_Realm%2FgcEJAQAAIAAJ%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26bsq%3D%2522French%2Blanguage%2Bcultures%2522%2B1974%2Bpacific%26dq%3D%2522French%2Blanguage%2Bcultures%2522%2B1974%2Bpacific%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-59"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-59">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHorn1936">Horn, Walter (1936). <a class="external text" href="http://hbs.bishopmuseum.org/pubs-online/pdf/op12-6.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>Check list of the Cicindelidae of Oceania</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Honolulu, Hawaii: Bishop Museum. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220309041008/http://hbs.bishopmuseum.org/pubs-online/pdf/op12-6.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 9 March 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 January</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Check+list+of+the+Cicindelidae+of+Oceania.&amp;rft.place=Honolulu%2C+Hawaii&amp;rft.pub=Bishop+Museum&amp;rft.date=1936&amp;rft.aulast=Horn&amp;rft.aufirst=Walter&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fhbs.bishopmuseum.org%2Fpubs-online%2Fpdf%2Fop12-6.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-countriesoftheworld-60"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-countriesoftheworld_60-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-countriesoftheworld_60-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-countriesoftheworld_60-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-countriesoftheworld_60-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-countriesoftheworld_60-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-countriesoftheworld_60-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-countriesoftheworld_60-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-countriesoftheworld_60-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBrown1876">Brown, Robert (1876). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/The_countries_of_the_world/3-0DAAAAQAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22oceania%22+%22juan%22+%22galapagos%22&amp;pg=PA2&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">"Oceania: General Characteristics"</a>. <i>The Countries of the World: Volume 4</i>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 February</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Oceania%3A+General+Characteristics&amp;rft.btitle=The+Countries+of+the+World%3A+Volume+4&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University&amp;rft.date=1876&amp;rft.aulast=Brown&amp;rft.aufirst=Robert&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FThe_countries_of_the_world%2F3-0DAAAAQAAJ%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522oceania%2522%2B%2522juan%2522%2B%2522galapagos%2522%26pg%3DPA2%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-stats-61"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-stats_61-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stats_61-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stats_61-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stats_61-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stats_61-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stats_61-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stats_61-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-stats_61-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/" rel="nofollow">"Countries or areas / geographical regions"</a>. United Nations. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170830170949/https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 August 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">25 April</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Countries+or+areas+%2F+geographical+regions&amp;rft.pub=United+Nations&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Funstats.un.org%2Funsd%2Fmethodology%2Fm49%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Lewis_1997_32-62"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Lewis_1997_32_62-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFLewisKären_E._Wigen1997">Lewis, Martin W.; Kären E. Wigen (1997). <span class="cs1-lock-limited" title="Free access subject to limited trial, subscription normally required"><a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/mythcontinentscr00lewi" rel="nofollow"><i>The Myth of Continents: a Critique of Metageography</i></a></span>. Berkeley: University of California Press. p. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/mythcontinentscr00lewi/page/n24" rel="nofollow">32</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-520-20742-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-520-20742-4"><bdi>978-0-520-20742-4</bdi></a>. <q>Interestingly enough, the answer [from a scholar who sought to calculate the number of continents] conformed almost precisely to the conventional list: North America, South America, Europe, Asia, Oceania (Australia plus New Zealand), Africa, and Antarctica.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Myth+of+Continents%3A+a+Critique+of+Metageography&amp;rft.place=Berkeley&amp;rft.pages=32&amp;rft.pub=University+of+California+Press&amp;rft.date=1997&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-520-20742-4&amp;rft.aulast=Lewis&amp;rft.aufirst=Martin+W.&amp;rft.au=K%C3%A4ren+E.+Wigen&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fmythcontinentscr00lewi&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-72">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFPandianParman2004">Pandian, Jacob; Parman, Susan (2004). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/The_Making_of_Anthropology/RgO8nLql2KwC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22some+exclude%22+%22ryukyu%22&amp;pg=PA206&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>The Making of Anthropology: The Semiotics of Self and Other in the Western Tradition</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-ess-74"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-ess_74-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ess_74-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ess_74-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ess_74-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCust1887">Cust, Robert Needham (1887). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Linguistic_and_Oriental_Essays_1847_1887/vZ4KtNU2-PMC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=0" rel="nofollow"><i>Linguistic and Oriental Essays: 1847-1887</i></a>. Trübner &amp; Company. p. 518. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064357/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Linguistic_and_Oriental_Essays_1847_1887/vZ4KtNU2-PMC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=0" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 March</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Linguistic+and+Oriental+Essays%3A+1847-1887&amp;rft.pages=518&amp;rft.pub=Tr%C3%BCbner+%26+Company&amp;rft.date=1887&amp;rft.aulast=Cust&amp;rft.aufirst=Robert+Needham&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FLinguistic_and_Oriental_Essays_1847_1887%2FvZ4KtNU2-PMC%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D0&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-75"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-75">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRoyal_Statistical_Society_(Great_Britain)1892">Royal Statistical Society (Great Britain) (1892). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Journal_of_the_Royal_Statistical_Society/hujWAAAAIAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22OCEANIA%22%27&amp;pg=PA309&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Journal of the Royal Statistical Society, Volume 55</i></a>. Royal Statistical Society. p. 309. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064359/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Journal_of_the_Royal_Statistical_Society/hujWAAAAIAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22OCEANIA%22%27&amp;pg=PA309&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">13 April</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Journal+of+the+Royal+Statistical+Society%2C+Volume+55&amp;rft.pages=309&amp;rft.pub=Royal+Statistical+Society.&amp;rft.date=1892&amp;rft.au=Royal+Statistical+Society+%28Great+Britain%29&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FJournal_of_the_Royal_Statistical_Society%2FhujWAAAAIAAJ%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522OCEANIA%2522%2527%26pg%3DPA309%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-chambers-76"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-chambers_76-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-chambers_76-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Chambers_s_New_Handy_Volume_American_Enc/J2NRAAAAYAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22easter+island%22+%22oceania%22+%22galapagos%22&amp;pg=PA657&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Chambers's New Handy Volume American Encyclopædia: Volume 9</i></a>. The University of Virginia. 1885. p. 657. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064400/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Chambers_s_New_Handy_Volume_American_Enc/J2NRAAAAYAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22easter+island%22+%22oceania%22+%22galapagos%22&amp;pg=PA657&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">13 March</span> 2022</span>. <q>the whole region has sometimes been called Oceania, and sometimes Australasia—generally, however, in modern times, to the exclusion of the islands in the Indian archipelago, to which certain writers have given the name of Malaysia [...] we have the three geographical divisions of Malaysia, Australasia and Polynesia, the last mentioned of which embraces all the groups and single islands not included under the other two. Accepting this arrangement, still the limits between Australasia and Polynesia have not been very accurately defined; indeed, scarcely any two geographers appear to be quite agreed upon the subject; neither shall we pretend to decide in the matter. The following list, however, comprises all the principal groups and single island not previously named as coming under the division of Australasia: 1. North of the equator—The Ladrone or Marian islands. the Pelew islands, the Caroline islands, the Radack and Ralick chains, the Sandwich islands, Gilbert's or Kingstnill's archipelago. and the Galapagos. 2. South of the equator—The Ellice group, the Phoenix and Union groups. the Fiji islands, the Friendly islands, the Navigator's islands. Cook's or Harvey islands, the Society islands. the Dangerous archipelago, the Marquesas islands, Pitcairn island, and Easter island.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Chambers%27s+New+Handy+Volume+American+Encyclop%C3%A6dia%3A+Volume+9&amp;rft.pages=657&amp;rft.pub=The+University+of+Virginia&amp;rft.date=1885&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FChambers_s_New_Handy_Volume_American_Enc%2FJ2NRAAAAYAAJ%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522easter%2Bisland%2522%2B%2522oceania%2522%2B%2522galapagos%2522%26pg%3DPA657%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-flick-77"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-flick_77-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-flick_77-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-flick_77-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFFlick1926">Flick, Alexander Clarence (1926). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Modern_World_History_1776_1926/PhGHAAAAMAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=0&amp;bsq=Modern%20World%20History,%201776-1926A%20Survey%20of%20the%20Origins%20and%20Development%20of%20Contemporary%20Civilization" rel="nofollow"><i>Modern World History, 1776-1926: A Survey of the Origins and Development of Contemporary Civilization</i></a>. A.A. Knopf. p. 492. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064936/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Modern_World_History_1776_1926/PhGHAAAAMAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=0&amp;bsq=Modern+World+History%2C+1776-1926A+Survey+of+the+Origins+and+Development+of+Contemporary+Civilization" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>

<li id="cite_note-chen-83"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-chen_83-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-chen_83-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFChenevièreSabater1995">Chenevière, Alain; Sabater, Roger (1995). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Pacific/So2r2OogWtoC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22form+part+of+it+since+they+are+attached+both%22&amp;dq=%22form+part+of+it+since+they+are+attached+both%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Pacific: The Boundless Ocean</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-84"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-84">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.researchgate.net/figure/Index-map-of-the-Ryukyu-Islands-Japanese-Islands-Honshu-Hokkaido-Shikoku-and_fig7_241713018" rel="nofollow">"Index map of the Ryukyu Islands, Japanese Islands (Honshu, Hokkaido, Shikoku, and Kyushu), and Taiwan"</a>. 2011. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220409002714/https://www.researchgate.net/figure/Index-map-of-the-Ryukyu-Islands-Japanese-Islands-Honshu-Hokkaido-Shikoku-and_fig7_241713018" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 9 April 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 April</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Index+map+of+the+Ryukyu+Islands%2C+Japanese+Islands+%28Honshu%2C+Hokkaido%2C+Shikoku%2C+and+Kyushu%29%2C+and+Taiwan.&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.researchgate.net%2Ffigure%2FIndex-map-of-the-Ryukyu-Islands-Japanese-Islands-Honshu-Hokkaido-Shikoku-and_fig7_241713018&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-nz-87"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-nz_87-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nz_87-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nz_87-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/The_World_and_Its_Peoples_Australia_New/4MhBAAAAIAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22excluded+from+oceania%22&amp;dq=%22excluded+from+oceania%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>The World and Its Peoples: Australia, New Zealand, Oceania</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-marine-88"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-marine_88-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-marine_88-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-marine_88-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFFriedlanderBallesterosCaselleGaymer2016">Friedlander, Alan M.; Ballesteros, Enric; Caselle, Jennifer E.; Gaymer, Carlos F.; Palma, Alvaro T.; Petit, Ignacio; Varas, Eduardo; Muñoz Wilson, Alex; Sala, Enric (6 January 2016). <a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4703205" rel="nofollow">"Marine Biodiversity in Juan Fernández and Desventuradas Islands, Chile: Global Endemism Hotspots"</a>. <i>PLOS ONE</i>. Journals.plos.org. <b>11</b> (1): e0145059. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2016PLoSO..1145059F" rel="nofollow">2016PLoSO..1145059F</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0145059" rel="nofollow">10.1371/journal.pone.0145059</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a> <span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4703205" rel="nofollow">4703205</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26734732" rel="nofollow">26734732</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=PLOS+ONE&amp;rft.atitle=Marine+Biodiversity+in+Juan+Fern%C3%A1ndez+and+Desventuradas+Islands%2C+Chile%3A+Global+Endemism+Hotspots&amp;rft.volume=11&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=e0145059&amp;rft.date=2016-01-06&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC4703205%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F26734732&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0145059&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2016PLoSO..1145059F&amp;rft.aulast=Friedlander&amp;rft.aufirst=Alan+M.&amp;rft.au=Ballesteros%2C+Enric&amp;rft.au=Caselle%2C+Jennifer+E.&amp;rft.au=Gaymer%2C+Carlos+F.&amp;rft.au=Palma%2C+Alvaro+T.&amp;rft.au=Petit%2C+Ignacio&amp;rft.au=Varas%2C+Eduardo&amp;rft.au=Mu%C3%B1oz+Wilson%2C+Alex&amp;rft.au=Sala%2C+Enric&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC4703205&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-east-89"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-east_89-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFPequeño2011">Pequeño, Germán (2011). "Shore Fishes of Easter Island, John E. Randall &amp; Alfredo Cea Egaña". <i>Gayana</i>. <b>75</b> (2): 201–202. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.4067%2FS0717-65382011000200011" rel="nofollow">10.4067/S0717-65382011000200011</a>. <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ProQuest_(identifier)" title="ProQuest (identifier)">ProQuest</a> <a class="external text" href="https://search.proquest.com/docview/920291064" rel="nofollow">920291064</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Gayana&amp;rft.atitle=Shore+Fishes+of+Easter+Island%2C+John+E.+Randall+%26+Alfredo+Cea+Ega%C3%B1a&amp;rft.volume=75&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=201-202&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.4067%2FS0717-65382011000200011&amp;rft.aulast=Peque%C3%B1o&amp;rft.aufirst=Germ%C3%A1n&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-90"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-90">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFLee1993">Lee, Georgia (1993). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Rapa_Nui_Journal/ZXvjAAAAMAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22juan+fernandez%22+%22oceania%22+%22rapa+nui%22&amp;dq=%22juan+fernandez%22+%22oceania%22+%22rapa+nui%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Rapa Nui Journal: Volumes 7-10</i></a>. University of Texas. p. 72. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064541/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Rapa_Nui_Journal/ZXvjAAAAMAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22juan+fernandez%22+%22oceania%22+%22rapa+nui%22&amp;dq=%22juan+fernandez%22+%22oceania%22+%22rapa+nui%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">19 March</span> 2022</span>. <q>[...] Chile Division of Cultural Affairs and Information (DIRACI) [stated] that Chile's area included "180 km2 (69.48 miles) of Oceania— Easter Island, Juan Fernandez Archipelago (Robinson Crusoe Island) and other islands off the Chilean coast." The <i>Pacific Islands Handbook</i> (1989) and <i>Encyclopedia of World Cultures</i> (1991) did not realize that they had overestimated Rapa Nui because of this.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Rapa+Nui+Journal%3A+Volumes+7-10&amp;rft.pages=72&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Texas&amp;rft.date=1993&amp;rft.aulast=Lee&amp;rft.aufirst=Georgia&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FRapa_Nui_Journal%2FZXvjAAAAMAAJ%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26bsq%3D%2522juan%2Bfernandez%2522%2B%2522oceania%2522%2B%2522rapa%2Bnui%2522%26dq%3D%2522juan%2Bfernandez%2522%2B%2522oceania%2522%2B%2522rapa%2Bnui%2522%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-91"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-91">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://wedocs.unep.org/bitstream/handle/20.500.11822/30152/RevOceania.pdf?sequence=1&amp;isAllowed=y" rel="nofollow"><i>Review of the Protected Areas System in Oceania</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources. 1986. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220120062626/https://wedocs.unep.org/bitstream/handle/20.500.11822/30152/RevOceania.pdf?sequence=1&amp;isAllowed=y" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 20 January 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 January</span> 2022</span>. <q>Easter Island on the east has been included on the basis of its Polynesian and biogeographic affinities even though it is politically apart. The other islands of the eastern Pacific (Galapagos, Juan Fernandez, etc.) have sometimes been included in Oceania.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Review+of+the+Protected+Areas+System+in+Oceania&amp;rft.pub=International+Union+for+Conservation+of+Nature+and+Natural+Resources&amp;rft.date=1986&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwedocs.unep.org%2Fbitstream%2Fhandle%2F20.500.11822%2F30152%2FRevOceania.pdf%3Fsequence%3D1%26isAllowed%3Dy&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-92"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-92">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://helictite.caves.org.au/pdf4/25.01.Issue.Print.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Oceania Bibliography"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Helictite: Journal of Australasian Cave Research</i>. <b>25</b> (1). 1987. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220322012745/https://helictite.caves.org.au/pdf4/25.01.Issue.Print.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 22 March 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 March</span> 2022</span>. <q>This paper covers the region from Irian Jaya (Western New Guinea, a province of New Guinea) in the west to Galapagos Islands (Equador) and Easter Island (Chile) in the east.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Helictite%3A+Journal+of+Australasian+Cave+Research&amp;rft.atitle=Oceania+Bibliography&amp;rft.volume=25&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.date=1987&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fhelictite.caves.org.au%2Fpdf4%2F25.01.Issue.Print.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-93"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-93">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFWillcox1980">Willcox, R. R. (1980). <a class="external text" href="https://sti.bmj.com/content/sextrans/56/4/204.full.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Venereal diseases in the islands of the South Pacific"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>British Journal of Venereal Diseases</i>. <b>56</b> (4): 204–209. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1136%2Fsti.56.4.204" rel="nofollow">10.1136/sti.56.4.204</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a> <span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1045778" rel="nofollow">1045778</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/7427693" rel="nofollow">7427693</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 September</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=British+Journal+of+Venereal+Diseases&amp;rft.atitle=Venereal+diseases+in+the+islands+of+the+South+Pacific&amp;rft.volume=56&amp;rft.issue=4&amp;rft.pages=204-209&amp;rft.date=1980&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC1045778%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F7427693&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1136%2Fsti.56.4.204&amp;rft.aulast=Willcox&amp;rft.aufirst=R.+R.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fsti.bmj.com%2Fcontent%2Fsextrans%2F56%2F4%2F204.full.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-ling-94"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-ling_94-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ling_94-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ling_94-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ling_94-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ling_94-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSebeok1971">Sebeok, Thomas Albert (1971). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Current_Trends_in_Linguistics_Linguistic/lYouAAAAMAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22multitude%22+oceania+%22linguistics%22&amp;dq=%22multitude%22+oceania+%22linguistics%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Current Trends in Linguistics: Linguistics in Oceania</i></a>. the University of Michigan. p. 950. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730065403/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Current_Trends_in_Linguistics_Linguistic/lYouAAAAMAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22multitude%22+oceania+%22linguistics%22&amp;dq=%22multitude%22+oceania+%22linguistics%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2 February</span> 2022</span>. <q>Most of this account of the influence of the Hispanic languages in Oceania has dealt with the Western Pacific, but the Eastern Pacific has not been without some share of the presence of the Portuguese and Spanish. The Eastern Pacific does not have the multitude of islands so characteristic of the Western regions of this great ocean, but there are some: Easter Island, 2000 miles off the Chilean coast, where a Polynesian tongue, Rapanui, is still spoken; the Juan Fernandez group, 400 miles west of Valparaiso; the Galapagos archipelago, 650 miles west of Ecuador; Malpelo and Cocos, 300 miles off the Colombian and Costa Rican coasts respectively; and others. Not many of these islands have extensive populations — some have been used effectively as prisons — but the official language on each is Spanish.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Current+Trends+in+Linguistics%3A+Linguistics+in+Oceania&amp;rft.pages=950&amp;rft.pub=the+University+of+Michigan&amp;rft.date=1971&amp;rft.aulast=Sebeok&amp;rft.aufirst=Thomas+Albert&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FCurrent_Trends_in_Linguistics_Linguistic%2FlYouAAAAMAAJ%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26bsq%3D%2522multitude%2522%2Boceania%2B%2522linguistics%2522%26dq%3D%2522multitude%2522%2Boceania%2B%2522linguistics%2522%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-lingtai-95"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-lingtai_95-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-lingtai_95-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBowen1971">Bowen, James Dean (1971). <li id="cite_note-clif-104"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-clif_104-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-clif_104-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFClifford2013">Clifford, James (2013). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Returns/5eewAAAAQBAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=0" rel="nofollow"><i>Returns</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-105"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-105">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFJones2014">Jones, Ryan Tucker (2 October 2014). <a class="external text" href="http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00223344.2014.975402" rel="nofollow">"Kelp Highways, Siberian Girls in Maui, and Nuclear Walruses: The North Pacific in a Sea of Islands"</a>. <i>The Journal of Pacific History</i>. <b>49</b> (4): 373–395. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F00223344.2014.975402" rel="nofollow">10.1080/00223344.2014.975402</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:161786559" rel="nofollow">161786559</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064720/https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/00223344.2014.975402" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-106"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-106">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHyoe1977">Hyoe, Murakami (1977). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Guides_to_Japanese_Culture/xiQhhOvtVJEC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22pacific+island+culture%22+%22japanese+culture%22&amp;dq=%22pacific+island+culture%22+%22japanese+culture%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Guides to Japanese Culture</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-120"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-120">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFVan_SoestKaiserVan_Syoc2011">Van Soest, Rob W. M.; Kaiser, Kirstie L.; Van Syoc, Robert (29 April 2011). <a class="external text" href="https://www.mapress.com/zt/article/view/zootaxa.2839.1.1" rel="nofollow">"Sponges from Clipperton Island, East Pacific"</a>. <i>Zootaxa</i>. Mapress.com. <b>2839</b> (1): 1–46–1–46. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.11646%2Fzootaxa.2839.1.1" rel="nofollow">10.11646/zootaxa.2839.1.1</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220227130813/https://www.mapress.com/zt/article/view/zootaxa.2839.1.1" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 27 February 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 February</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Zootaxa&amp;rft.atitle=Sponges+from+Clipperton+Island%2C+East+Pacific&amp;rft.volume=2839&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=1-46-1-46&amp;rft.date=2011-04-29&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.11646%2Fzootaxa.2839.1.1&amp;rft.aulast=Van+Soest&amp;rft.aufirst=Rob+W.+M.&amp;rft.au=Kaiser%2C+Kirstie+L.&amp;rft.au=Van+Syoc%2C+Robert&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mapress.com%2Fzt%2Farticle%2Fview%2Fzootaxa.2839.1.1&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-121"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-121">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMoncrieff1907">Moncrieff, Robert Hope (1907). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/The_World_of_To_day/VPVaAAAAQAAJ?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;bsq=%22easter+island%22+%22clipperton+island%22+%22oceania%22&amp;dq=%22easter+island%22+%22clipperton+island%22+%22oceania%22&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>The World of To-day A Survey of the Lands and Peoples of The Globe as Seen in Travel and Commerce: Volume 4</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-global-122"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-global_122-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-global_122-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/oceania/index.html" rel="nofollow">"Oceania Military Guide"</a>. <i>GlobalSecurity.org</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220106012544/https://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/oceania/index.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 6 January 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">6 January</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=GlobalSecurity.org&amp;rft.atitle=Oceania+Military+Guide&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.globalsecurity.org%2Fmilitary%2Fworld%2Foceania%2Findex.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-janick-123"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-janick_123-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFJanick2010">Janick, Jules (2010). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Horticultural_Reviews_Volume_36/DrXCupIJVQMC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22galapagos%22+%22oceania%22+%22polynesia%22&amp;pg=PA146&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>Horticultural Reviews, Volume 36</i></a>. Wiley. p. 146. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780470527221" title="Special:BookSources/9780470527221"><bdi>9780470527221</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064634/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/Horticultural_Reviews_Volume_36/DrXCupIJVQMC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22galapagos%22+%22oceania%22+%22polynesia%22&amp;pg=PA146&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 February</span> 2022</span>. <q>Oceania is a broadly applied term for the thousands of islands in the Pacific Ocean. They range from extremely small, uninhabited islands, to large ones, including Australia, New Zealand and New Guinea. Oceania is further grouped into three regions, Melanesia, Micronesia and Polynesia. There a few other Pacific island groups that do not fit into these groupings, such as Galapagos.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Horticultural+Reviews%2C+Volume+36&amp;rft.pages=146&amp;rft.pub=Wiley&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft.isbn=9780470527221&amp;rft.aulast=Janick&amp;rft.aufirst=Jules&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FHorticultural_Reviews_Volume_36%2FDrXCupIJVQMC%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522galapagos%2522%2B%2522oceania%2522%2B%2522polynesia%2522%26pg%3DPA146%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-124"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-124">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Welsch, Bernhard. (2004). "Was Marcus Island Discovered by Bernardo de la Torre in 1543?" <i>Journal of Pacific History</i>, 39:1, 109–122.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-devchris-125"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-devchris_125-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-devchris_125-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFErnstAnisi2016">Ernst, Manfred; Anisi, Anna (1 February 2016). <a class="external text" href="https://www.academia.edu/33371338" rel="nofollow">"The Historical Development of Christianity in Oceania"</a>. <i>Sanneh/Wiley</i>: 588–604. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220412012839/https://www.academia.edu/33371338" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 12 April 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 July</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Sanneh%2FWiley&amp;rft.atitle=The+Historical+Development+of+Christianity+in+Oceania&amp;rft.pages=588-604&amp;rft.date=2016-02-01&amp;rft.aulast=Ernst&amp;rft.aufirst=Manfred&amp;rft.au=Anisi%2C+Anna&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.academia.edu%2F33371338&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-francepacific-126"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-francepacific_126-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAldrich1993">Aldrich, Robert (1993). <a class="external text" href="https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/France_and_the_South_Pacific_since_1940/tLTDYaHhrZgC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22with+the+ending+of+the+trust+territory%22&amp;pg=PA347&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow"><i>France and the South Pacific Since 1940</i></a>. University of Hawaiʻi Press. p. 347. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780824815585" title="Special:BookSources/9780824815585"><bdi>9780824815585</bdi></a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220730064637/https://www.google.com.au/books/edition/France_and_the_South_Pacific_since_1940/tLTDYaHhrZgC?hl=en&amp;gbpv=1&amp;dq=%22with+the+ending+of+the+trust+territory%22&amp;pg=PA347&amp;printsec=frontcover" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 30 July 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 February</span> 2022</span>. <q>Britain's high commissioner in New Zealand continues to administer Pitcairn, and the other former British colonies remain members of the Commonwealth of Nations, recognizing the British Queen as their titular head of state and vesting certain residual powers in the British government or the Queen's representative in the islands. Australia did not cede control of the Torres Strait Islands, inhabited by a Melanesian population, or Lord Howe and Norfolk Island, whose residents are of European ancestry. New Zealand retains indirect rule over Niue and Tokelau and has kept close relations with another former possession, the Cook Islands, through a compact of free association. Chile rules Easter Island (Rapa Nui) and Ecuador rules the Galapagos Islands. The Aboriginals of Australia, the Maoris of New Zealand and the native Polynesians of Hawaii, despite movements demanding more cultural recognition, greater economic and political considerations or even outright sovereignty, have remained minorities in countries where massive waves of migration have completely changed society. In short, Oceania has remained one of the least completely decolonized regions on the globe.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=France+and+the+South+Pacific+Since+1940&amp;rft.pages=347&amp;rft.pub=University+of+Hawai%26%23x02BB%3Bi+Press&amp;rft.date=1993&amp;rft.isbn=9780824815585&amp;rft.aulast=Aldrich&amp;rft.aufirst=Robert&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com.au%2Fbooks%2Fedition%2FFrance_and_the_South_Pacific_since_1940%2FtLTDYaHhrZgC%3Fhl%3Den%26gbpv%3D1%26dq%3D%2522with%2Bthe%2Bending%2Bof%2Bthe%2Btrust%2Bterritory%2522%26pg%3DPA347%26printsec%3Dfrontcover&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-127"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-127">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.springer.com/journal/12140" rel="nofollow">"East Asia"</a>. <i>Springer</i>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Springer&amp;rft.atitle=East+Asia&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.springer.com%2Fjournal%2F12140&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-128"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-128">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFRowlandKerkhove2022">Rowland, Michael J.; Kerkhove, Raymond C. (10 June 2022). <a class="external text" href="https://journals.jcu.edu.au/qar/article/view/3889" rel="nofollow">"Evidence of external contact between the Pacific Basin and the east coast of Australia during the Holocene: A review"</a>. <i>Queensland Archaeological Research</i>. <b>25</b>: 47–66. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.25120%2Fqar.25.2022.3889" rel="nofollow">10.25120/qar.25.2022.3889</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:249593234" rel="nofollow">249593234</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220610061245/https://journals.jcu.edu.au/qar/article/view/3889" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 10 June 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-132"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-132">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHanihara1977">Hanihara, Kazuro (1977). <a class="external text" href="https://www.degruyter.com/document/doi/10.1515/9783110807554.195/pdf" rel="nofollow">"Dentition of the Ainu and the Australian Aborigines"</a>. <i>Orofacial Growth and Development</i>. pp. 195–200. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1515%2F9783110807554.195" rel="nofollow">10.1515/9783110807554.195</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-90-279-7889-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-90-279-7889-9"><bdi>978-90-279-7889-9</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Dentition+of+the+Ainu+and+the+Australian+Aborigines&amp;rft.btitle=Orofacial+Growth+and+Development&amp;rft.pages=195-200&amp;rft.date=1977&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1515%2F9783110807554.195&amp;rft.isbn=978-90-279-7889-9&amp;rft.aulast=Hanihara&amp;rft.aufirst=Kazuro&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.degruyter.com%2Fdocument%2Fdoi%2F10.1515%2F9783110807554.195%2Fpdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
