<li id="cite_note-133"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-133">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHudson2017">Hudson, Mark J. (2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/j.ctt1pwtd26.17.pdf" rel="nofollow">"The Ryukyu Islands and the Northern Frontier of Prehistoric Austronesian Settlement"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>New Perspectives in Southeast Asian and Pacific Prehistory</i>. Vol. 45. ANU Press. pp. 189–200. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9781760460945" title="Special:BookSources/9781760460945"><bdi>9781760460945</bdi></a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctt1pwtd26.17" rel="nofollow">j.ctt1pwtd26.17</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=The+Ryukyu+Islands+and+the+Northern+Frontier+of+Prehistoric+Austronesian+Settlement&amp;rft.btitle=New+Perspectives+in+Southeast+Asian+and+Pacific+Prehistory&amp;rft.pages=189-200&amp;rft.pub=ANU+Press&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2Fj.ctt1pwtd26.17%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft.isbn=9781760460945&amp;rft.aulast=Hudson&amp;rft.aufirst=Mark+J.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2Fpdf%2Fj.ctt1pwtd26.17.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-147"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-147">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://parksaustralia.gov.au/marine/pub/scientific-publications/archive/conservation-christmas-cocos.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Conservation values in Commonwealth waters of the Christmas and Cocos (Keeling) Island remote Australian territories"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. CSIRO. August 2009. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220401084035/https://parksaustralia.gov.au/marine/pub/scientific-publications/archive/conservation-christmas-cocos.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 1 April 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 June</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Conservation+values+in+Commonwealth+waters+of+the+Christmas+and+Cocos+%28Keeling%29+Island+remote+Australian+territories&amp;rft.pub=CSIRO&amp;rft.date=2009-08&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fparksaustralia.gov.au%2Fmarine%2Fpub%2Fscientific-publications%2Farchive%2Fconservation-christmas-cocos.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-races165-175"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-races165_175-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="http://www.inquirewithin.biz/history/american_pacific/oceania/orientation.htm" rel="nofollow">The History of Mankind</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130927110432/http://www.inquirewithin.biz/history/american_pacific/oceania/orientation.htm" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 27 September 2013 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> by Professor Friedrich Ratzel, Book II, Section A, The Races of Oceania p. 165, picture of a stick chart from the Marshall Islands. MacMillan and Co., published 1896.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-matrilineality2003-176"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-matrilineality2003_176-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFHageMarck2003">Hage, P.; Marck, J. (2003). "Matrilineality and Melanesian Origin of Polynesian Y Chromosomes". <i>Current Anthropology</i>. <b>44</b> (S5): S121. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1086%2F379272" rel="nofollow">10.1086/379272</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:224791767" rel="nofollow">224791767</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Current+Anthropology&amp;rft.atitle=Matrilineality+and+Melanesian+Origin+of+Polynesian+Y+Chromosomes&amp;rft.volume=44&amp;rft.issue=S5&amp;rft.pages=S121&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1086%2F379272&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A224791767%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.aulast=Hage&amp;rft.aufirst=P.&amp;rft.au=Marck%2C+J.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Kayser,_M._2006-177"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Kayser,_M._2006_177-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFKayserBrauerCordauxCasto2006">Kayser, M.; Brauer, S.; Cordaux, R.; Casto, A.; Lao, O.; Zhivotovsky, L.A.; Moyse-Faurie, C.; Rutledge, R.B.;  et al. <li id="cite_note-wings-179"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-wings_179-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFKirch2000">Kirch, P.V. <li id="cite_note-test-180"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-test_180-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFGreenLeach1989">Green, Roger C.; Leach, Helen M. </li>
<li id="cite_note-burley128-181"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-burley128_181-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFBurleyBartonDickinsonConnaughton2010">Burley, David V.; Barton, Andrew; Dickinson, William R.; Connaughton, Sean P.; Taché, Karine (2010). "Nukuleka as a Founder Colony for West Polynesian Settlement: New Insights from Recent Excavations". <i>Journal of Pacific Archaeology</i>. <b>1</b> (2): 128–144.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Pacific+Archaeology&amp;rft.atitle=Nukuleka+as+a+Founder+Colony+for+West+Polynesian+Settlement%3A+New+Insights+from+Recent+Excavations&amp;rft.volume=1&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=128-144&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft.aulast=Burley&amp;rft.aufirst=David+V.&amp;rft.au=Barton%2C+Andrew&amp;rft.au=Dickinson%2C+William+R.&amp;rft.au=Connaughton%2C+Sean+P.&amp;rft.au=Tach%C3%A9%2C+Karine&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-vikings228-182"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-vikings228_182-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Resemblance of the name to an early <a href="/wiki/Mangareva" title="Mangareva">Mangarevan</a> founder god <i><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Atu_Motua&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Atu Motua (page does not exist)">Atu Motua</a></i> ("Father Lord") has made some historians suspect that Hotu Matua was added to Easter Island mythology only in the 1860s, along with adopting the Mangarevan language. The "real" founder would have been <i><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Tu%27u_ko_Iho&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Tu'u ko Iho (page does not exist)">Tu'u ko Iho</a></i>, who became just a supporting character in Hotu Matuʻa centric legends. See Steven Fischer (1994). <i>Rapanui's Tu'u ko Iho Versus Mangareva's 'Atu Motua. Evidence for Multiple Reanalysis and Replacement in Rapanui Settlement Traditions, Easter Island</i>. The Journal of Pacific History, 29(1), 3–18. See also <i>Rapa Nui / Geography, History and Religion</i>. Peter H. Buck, Vikings of the Pacific, University of Chicago Press, 1938. pp. 228–236. <a class="external text" href="http://pvs.kcc.hawaii.edu/rapanui/rapa1.html" rel="nofollow">Online version</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20050523092130/http://pvs.kcc.hawaii.edu/rapanui/rapa1.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 2005-05-23 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-hawaii-183"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-hawaii_183-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20040928070714/http://pvs.kcc.hawaii.edu/rapanui/hotu.html" rel="nofollow">"The Hotu Matua"</a>. <i>archive.hokulea.com</i>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="https://archive.hokulea.com/rapanui/hotu.html" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 28 September 2004.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=archive.hokulea.com&amp;rft.atitle=The+Hotu+Matua&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.hokulea.com%2Frapanui%2Fhotu.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-failor89-184"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-failor89_184-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Jared_Diamond" title="Jared Diamond">Diamond, Jared</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Collapse:_How_Societies_Choose_to_Fail_or_Succeed" title="Collapse: How Societies Choose to Fail or Succeed">Collapse: How Societies Choose to Fail or Succeed</a></i>. Penguin Books: 2005. <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-14-303655-6" title="Special:BookSources/0-14-303655-6">0-14-303655-6</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-scimag23874-185"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-scimag23874_185-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Hunt, T.L., Lipo, C.P., 2006. Science, 1121879. See also <a class="external text" href="http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/1121879v1" rel="nofollow">"Late Colonization of Easter Island"</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20100529212552/http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/1121879v1" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 2010-05-29 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> in <i>Science Magazine</i>. <a class="external text" href="http://www.anthropology.hawaii.edu/projects/rapanui/hunt_lipo2006.pdf" rel="nofollow">Entire article</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080829124029/http://www.anthropology.hawaii.edu/projects/rapanui/hunt_lipo2006.pdf" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 29 August 2008 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> is also hosted by the Department of Anthropology of the University of Hawaiʻi.</span>

<li id="cite_note-tearag-189"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-tearag_189-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.teara.govt.nz/en/european-discovery-of-new-zealand/2" rel="nofollow">"European discovery of New Zealand"</a>. <li id="cite_note-portrait-225"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-portrait_225-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFLofflerAnneliese_LofflerA.J._RoseDenis_Warner1983">Loffler, Ernst; Anneliese Loffler; A.J. Rose; Denis Warner (1983). <i>Australia: Portrait of a continent</i>. <li id="cite_note-Turner-242"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Turner_242-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFTurnerRose1989">Turner, Angela K; Rose, Chris (1989). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/swallowsmartinsi00turn" rel="nofollow"><i>Swallows &amp; Martins: An Identification Guide and Handbook</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-matology105-269"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-matology105_269-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFLongmanGiambelluca2015">Longman, R.J.; Giambelluca, T.W. "Climatology of Haleakala". <i>Climatology of Haleakalā Technical Report No. 193</i>. <b>1</b> (1): 105–106.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Climatology+of+Haleakal%C4%81+Technical+Report+No.+193.&amp;rft.atitle=Climatology+of+Haleakala&amp;rft.volume=1&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=105-106&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft.aulast=Longman&amp;rft.aufirst=R.J.&amp;rft.au=Giambelluca%2C+T.W.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-region-270"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-region_270-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Regions and constituents as per <a href="/wiki/File:United_Nations_geographical_subregions.png" title="File:United Nations geographical subregions.png">UN categorisations/map</a> except <a href="#endnote_CCAU">notes 2–3</a>, 6. Depending on definitions, various territories cited below (notes 3, 5–7, 9) may be in <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_countries_spanning_more_than_one_continent" title="List of countries spanning more than one continent">one or both of</a> Oceania and Asia or North America.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Australasia-271"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Australasia_271-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The use and scope of this term varies. The UN designation for this subregion is "Australia and New Zealand".</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-nzpol-272"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-nzpol_272-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">New Zealand is often considered part of Polynesia rather than <a href="/wiki/Australasia" title="Australasia">Australasia</a>.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Melanesia-273"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Melanesia_273-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Excludes parts of Indonesia, island territories in <a href="/wiki/Southeast_Asia" title="Southeast Asia">Southeast Asia</a> (UN region) frequently reckoned in this region.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-note000-274"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-note000_274-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">According to the Act of Papua Autonomy (Undang-Undang Otonomi Khusus bagi Provinsi Papua) section 2 verse 2, the province itself has its own flag and arms, similar to other provinces. However, the flag and arms are not representations of sovereignty over the Republic of Indonesia.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-papauto-275"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-papauto_275-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170712195402/http://www.kinerja.or.id/pdf/8bbcd469-bc2c-4d89-bf63-c2d81804ae27.pdf" rel="nofollow">"UNDANG-UNDANG REPUBLIK INDONESIA NOMOR 21 TAHUN 2001 TENTANG OTONOMI KHUSUS BAGI PROVINSI PAPUA"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. 12 July 2017. </li>
<li id="cite_note-note111-276"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-note111_276-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">West Papua was split from Papua province in 2003 but still retain autonomous status</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-rnzi07-277"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-rnzi07_277-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.rnzi.com/pages/news.php?op=read&amp;id=29965" rel="nofollow">"Papuan province changes name from West Irian Jaya to West Papua"</a>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">27 December</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Papuan+province+changes+name+from+West+Irian+Jaya+to+West+Papua&amp;rft.pub=Radio+New+Zealand+International&amp;rft.date=2007-02-07&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.rnzi.com%2Fpages%2Fnews.php%3Fop%3Dread%26id%3D29965&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pngaus-278"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-pngaus_278-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Papua_New_Guinea" title="Papua New Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a> is often considered part of <a href="/wiki/Australasia" title="Australasia">Australasia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Melanesia" title="Melanesia">Melanesia</a>. It is sometimes included in the <a href="/wiki/Malay_Archipelago" title="Malay Archipelago">Malay Archipelago</a> of <a href="/wiki/Southeast_Asia" title="Southeast Asia">Southeast Asia</a>.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Palau-279"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Palau_279-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">On 7 October 2006, government officials moved their offices in the former capital of <a href="/wiki/Koror" title="Koror">Koror</a> to <a href="/wiki/Ngerulmud" title="Ngerulmud">Ngerulmud</a> in the state of <a href="/wiki/Melekeok" title="Melekeok">Melekeok</a>, located 20 km (12 mi) northeast of Koror on <a href="/wiki/Babeldaob" title="Babeldaob">Babelthuap Island</a>.<br/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-ASamoa-280"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ASamoa_280-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Fagatogo" title="Fagatogo">Fagatogo</a> is the seat of government of <a href="/wiki/American_Samoa" title="American Samoa">American Samoa</a>.<br/></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-Hoffman-312"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Hoffman_312-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFHoffman1899">Hoffman, Frederic L. <li id="cite_note-bat-314"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-bat_314-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMares2002">Mares, Peter (2002). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=XiPAMuTaQFEC" rel="nofollow"><i>Borderline: Australia's Treatment of Refugees and Asylum Seekers in the Wake of the Tampa</i></a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-doi10.1016/j.ajhg.2014.03.014-315"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-doi10.1016/j.ajhg.2014.03.014_315-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-doi10.1016/j.ajhg.2014.03.014_315-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFDugganEvansFriedlaenderFriedlaender2014">Duggan, A.T.; Evans, B.; Friedlaender, F.O.R.; Friedlaender, J.S.; Koki, G.; Merriwether, D.A.; Kayser, M.; Stoneking, M. <li id="cite_note-ausnatacc-346"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ausnatacc_346-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.abs.gov.au/ausstats/abs@.nsf/mf/5249.0?OpenDocument" rel="nofollow">"5249.0 – Australian National Accounts: Tourism Satellite Account, 2010–11"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Australian_Bureau_of_Statistics" title="Australian Bureau of Statistics">Australian Bureau of Statistics</a>. 14 December 2017. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180615135014/http://www.abs.gov.au/ausstats/abs@.nsf/mf/5249.0?OpenDocument" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 15 June 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-artino-402"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-artino_402-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBrunt2012">Brunt, Peter (2012). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/artinoceanianewh0000unse/page/410" rel="nofollow"><i>Art in Oceania: A New History</i></a>. New Haven and London: Yale University Press. pp. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/artinoceanianewh0000unse/page/410" rel="nofollow">410–497</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-300-19028-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-300-19028-1"><bdi>978-0-300-19028-1</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Art+in+Oceania%3A+A+New+History&amp;rft.place=New+Haven+and+London&amp;rft.pages=410-497&amp;rft.pub=Yale+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-300-19028-1&amp;rft.aulast=Brunt&amp;rft.aufirst=Peter&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fartinoceanianewh0000unse%2Fpage%2F410&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-oce-403"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-oce_403-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Hutchinson_Encyclopedia" title="Hutchinson Encyclopedia">Hutchinson Encyclopedia</a>. <a class="external text" href="http://www.tiscali.co.uk/reference/encyclopaedia/hutchinson/m0039821.html" rel="nofollow">Oceanic art</a> <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20060515024646/http://www.tiscali.co.uk/reference/encyclopaedia/hutchinson/m0039821.html" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> 15 May 2006 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-abc20140703-441"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-abc20140703_441-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-07-03/australia-and-new-zealand-to-compete-in-pacific-games/5568956" rel="nofollow">"Australia and New Zealand to compete in Pacific Games"</a>. <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Further_reading">Further reading</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Oceania&amp;action=edit&amp;section=48" title="Edit section: Further reading">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFDavison,_Hirst_and_Macintyre">Davison, Graeme; <a href="/wiki/John_Hirst_(historian)" title="John Hirst (historian)">Hirst, John</a>; <a href="/wiki/Stuart_Macintyre" title="Stuart Macintyre">Macintyre, Stuart</a> (1998). <i>The Oxford Companion to Australian History</i>. Melbourne: Oxford University Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-19-553597-9" title="Special:BookSources/0-19-553597-9"><bdi>0-19-553597-9</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Oxford+Companion+to+Australian+History&amp;rft.place=Melbourne&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1998&amp;rft.isbn=0-19-553597-9&amp;rft.au=Davison%2C+Graeme&amp;rft.au=Hirst%2C+John&amp;rft.au=Macintyre%2C+Stuart&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Frank_Harary" title="Frank Harary">Frank Harary</a> &amp; Per Hage (1991) <i>Exchange in Oceania: A Graph Theoretic Analysis</i>, Oxford Studies in Social and Cultural Anthropology, <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>.</li>
<li>Frank Harary &amp; Per Hage (2007) <i>Island Networks: Communication, Kinship, and Classification Structures in Oceania</i>, Structural Analysis in the Social Sciences, <a href="/wiki/Cambridge_University_Press" title="Cambridge University Press">Cambridge University Press</a>.</li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFJupp">Jupp, James (2001). <i>The Australian people: an encyclopedia of the nation, its people, and their origins</i>. Cambridge University Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-80789-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-521-80789-0"><bdi>978-0-521-80789-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Australian+people%3A+an+encyclopedia+of+the+nation%2C+its+people%2C+and+their+origins&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-521-80789-0&amp;rft.aulast=Jupp&amp;rft.aufirst=James&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFLewis_&amp;_Wigen,_The_Myth_of_Continents1997">Lewis, Martin W.; <a href="/wiki/K%C3%A4ren_Wigen" title="Kären Wigen">Wigen, Kären E.</a> (1997). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=C2as0sWxFBAC" rel="nofollow"><i>The Myth of Continents: a Critique of Metageography</i></a>. Berkeley: University of California Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-520-20743-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-520-20743-1"><bdi>978-0-520-20743-1</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Myth+of+Continents%3A+a+Critique+of+Metageography&amp;rft.place=Berkeley&amp;rft.pub=University+of+California+Press&amp;rft.date=1997&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-520-20743-1&amp;rft.aulast=Lewis&amp;rft.aufirst=Martin+W.&amp;rft.au=Wigen%2C+K%C3%A4ren+E.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DC2as0sWxFBAC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFTeo">Teo, Hsu-Ming; White, Richard (2003). <i>Cultural history in Australia</i>. University of New South Wales Press. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-86840-589-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-86840-589-6"><bdi>978-0-86840-589-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Cultural+history+in+Australia&amp;rft.pub=University+of+New+South+Wales+Press&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-86840-589-6&amp;rft.au=Teo%2C+Hsu-Ming&amp;rft.au=White%2C+Richard&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AOceania"></span></li></ul>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Capitals_of_Oceania" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:List_of_Oceanian_capitals_by_region" title="Template:List of Oceanian capitals by region"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:List_of_Oceanian_capitals_by_region" title="Template talk:List of Oceanian capitals by region"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:List_of_Oceanian_capitals_by_region&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Capitals_of_Oceania" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Capital_city" title="Capital city">Capitals</a> of Oceania</div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div id="Dependent_territories_are_in_italics"><a href="/wiki/Dependent_territory" title="Dependent territory">Dependent territories</a> are in italics</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Australasia" title="Australasia">Australasia</a></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Canberra" title="Canberra">Canberra</a></b>, <a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia">Australia</a></li>
